009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020/**
021 * This class implements 2D point fitting under affine transformations.
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2022/08/01
025 */
026public class AffineFit2D implements LinearFit2D {
027        
028        private final RealMatrix A;             // the calculated transformation matrix
029        private final double err;               // the calculated error
030        
031        /**
032         * Constructor.
033         * Fits two sequences of 2D points using an affine transformation model.
034         * At least 3 point pairs are required. For 3 point pairs, the solution
035         * is an exact fit, otherwise a least-squares fit is found.
036         * @param P the source points
037         * @param Q the target points
038         */
039        public AffineFit2D(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {      // 
040                checkSize(P, Q);
041                int m = P.length;
042                
043                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2 * m, 6);
044                RealVector b = new ArrayRealVector(2 * m);
045                
046                // mount the matrix M
047                int row = 0;
048                for (Pnt2d p : P) {
049                        M.setEntry(row, 0, p.getX());
050                        M.setEntry(row, 1, p.getY());
051                        M.setEntry(row, 2, 1);
052                        row++;
053                        M.setEntry(row, 3, p.getX());
054                        M.setEntry(row, 4, p.getY());
055                        M.setEntry(row, 5, 1);
056                        row++;
057                }
058                
059                // mount vector b
060                row = 0;
061                for (Pnt2d q : Q) {
062                        b.setEntry(row, q.getX());
063                        row++;
064                        b.setEntry(row, q.getY());
065                        row++;
066                }
067                
068                // solve M * a = b (for the unknown parameter vector a):
069                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(M).getSolver();
070                RealVector a = solver.solve(b);
071                A = makeTransformationMatrix(a);
072                err = calculateError(P, Q, A);
073        }
074
075        // creates a (2 x 3) transformation matrix from the elements of a
076        private RealMatrix makeTransformationMatrix(RealVector a) {
077                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2, 3);
078                int i = 0;
079                for (int row = 0; row < 2; row++) {
080                        // get (n+1) elements from a and place in row
081                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
082                                A.setEntry(row, j, a.getEntry(i));
083                                i++;
084                        }
085                }
086                return A;
087        }
088        
089        // --------------------------------------------------------
090        
091        private void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
092                if (P.length < 3 || Q.length < 3) {
093                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least 3 point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
094                }
095        }
096        
097        // --------------------------------------------------------
098
099        @Override
100        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
101                return A.getData();
102//              return A;
103        }
104
105        @Override
106        public double getError() {
107                return err;
108        }
109
110}
